headline: SpaceX $1.5 Trillion Value Target Hinges on Starlink — And Elon
summary: SpaceX is planning an initial public offering that may be the world’s biggest ever.  Of listed firms with similar characteristics, only Palantir Technologies Inc. comes close, at about 70 times.  The near-term investment case is that Starlink and a nascent mobile phone service fueled by its acquisition of spectrum from EchoStar Corp. provide the foundation for the outsize growth that IPO buyers will demand.

raw.headline: SpaceX $1.5 Trillion Value Target Hinges on Starlink — And Elon
raw.summary: SpaceX is planning an initial public offering that may be the world’s biggest ever.  Of listed firms with similar characteristics, only Palantir Technologies Inc. comes close, at about 70 times.  The near-term investment case is that Starlink and a nascent mobile phone service fueled by its acquisition of spectrum from EchoStar Corp. provide the foundation for the outsize growth that IPO buyers will demand.

headline: Amazon Developing One-Hour In-Store Pickup Service, Report Says
summary: This article first appeared on GuruFocus.  Amazon (AMZN, Financials) is developing an in-store pickup service that would allow customers to collect orders within an hour, Business Insider reported, citing internal documents and a person familiar with the project.  The feature would let shoppers place a unified order across Amazon's e-commerce inventory and its physical retail outlets.

headline: Amazon plans new one-hour pickup service in stores, Business Insider reports
summary: Amazon is developing a "rush" pickup service that would let customers collect ​orders from its stores within an ‌hour, Business Insider reported on Thursday, citing an internal document ‌and a person familiar with the matter.  The feature would allow shoppers to place a "unified" order combining items from Amazon's online store and its ⁠physical outlets, according ‌to the report.  The e-commerce giant plans to pilot the program in at ​least one metropolitan area by early 2026, ‌though the timeline may have changed, Business Insider reported.

headline: Inside India’s AI vision: Top bureaucrat on why big tech is pouring billions into India
summary: India is emerging as a major AI and data-center hub, with global tech giants like Microsoft, Amazon & Google investing billions into tech infrastructure in the country. In an exclusive interview, the secretary of India's Ministry of Electronics and IT, S Krishnan, outlines India’s strategy. He says the country is focusing on AI applications, expanding data centers and jobs through indirect growth. Krishnan also suggests that India's homegrown AI players could also enter the scene soon.

raw.headline: Inside India’s AI vision: Top bureaucrat on why big tech is pouring billions into India
raw.summary: India is emerging as a major AI and data-center hub, with global tech giants like Microsoft, Amazon & Google investing billions into tech infrastructure in the country. In an exclusive interview, the secretary of India's Ministry of Electronics and IT, S Krishnan, outlines India’s strategy. He says the country is focusing on AI applications, expanding data centers and jobs through indirect growth. Krishnan also suggests that India's homegrown AI players could also enter the scene soon.

headline: It Looked Like A Scam Email Asking To Venmo $100. Then He Realized It Was A Mandatory Contribution To A Lavish Gift For The Boss
summary: A manager at a successful small business was stunned to receive what looked like a phishing email: a request to Venmo $100 to the company president. The supposed reason? A group gift for the owner. But it wasn’t a scam. It was real. And, apparently, not optional. Managers Were Expected To Chip In The Reddit post, shared under r/smallbusiness, came from an employee who had only been at the 80-person company for less than a year. The business brings in around $50 million in revenue and has no debt
